channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Sudan Archives shared how synthesizers and tech shaped her new album
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Brittney Denise Sparks of Sudan Archives about her new album The BPM. She talks about how discovering the electric violin in her teens changed things for her.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Brittney Denise Sparks of Sudan Archives about her new album The BPM. She talks about how discovering the electric violin in her teens changed things for her.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Jeff Hiller's Emmy win has been surprisingly meaningful for him, he says
item.description: Jeff Hiller won an Emmy this year for his role in HBO's "Somebody Somewhere." The recognition came after decades of bit roles in TV. And he says the win has been unexpectedly meaningful for him.
item.content:encoded: Jeff Hiller won an Emmy this year for his role in HBO's "Somebody Somewhere." The recognition came after decades of bit roles in TV. And he says the win has been unexpectedly meaningful for him.

item.title: Intense mental exercise may be able to offset the effects of aging, research finds
item.description: A new study shows that cognitive training can increase the levels of a key chemical messenger in the brain responsible for decision-making.
item.content:encoded: A new study shows that cognitive training can increase the levels of a key chemical messenger in the brain responsible for decision-making.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: A legal analyst weighs in on the federal indictment of John Bolton
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks to former top FBI lawyer Andrew Weissmann about the federal indictment of John Bolton, the former National Security Adviser under President Trump during his first term.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks to former top FBI lawyer Andrew Weissmann about the federal indictment of John Bolton, the former National Security Adviser under President Trump during his first term.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Jumper, a wild horse famous for jumping fences in North Carolina, has died
item.description: Wild horse manager Meg Puckett remembers the horse "Jumper," a wild horse on North Carolina's Outer Banks famous for jumping fences.
item.content:encoded: Wild horse manager Meg Puckett remembers the horse "Jumper," a wild horse on North Carolina's Outer Banks famous for jumping fences.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: American farmers were already struggling. The shutdown made it worse
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with fourth generation farmer and advocate Joe Maxwell about how the government shutdown is stressing already overwhelmed American farmers.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with fourth generation farmer and advocate Joe Maxwell about how the government shutdown is stressing already overwhelmed American farmers.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Mexican singer Meme del Real blends indie rock and Latin rhythms
item.description: Meme del Real has been part of the beloved Mexican rock band Café Tacvba for more than 30 years. This week, the 56-year-old singer released his debut solo record.
item.content:encoded: Meme del Real has been part of the beloved Mexican rock band Café Tacvba for more than 30 years. This week, the 56-year-old singer released his debut solo record.
item.dc:creator: Anamaria Artemisa Sayre

item.title: No Kings organizers say protests against the Trump administration will be peaceful
item.description: The second national No Kings protest will take place in various cities this weekend. In the Chicago area, it's against a backdrop of escalating tensions.
item.content:encoded: The second national No Kings protest will take place in various cities this weekend. In the Chicago area, it's against a backdrop of escalating tensions.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Pupovac

item.title: Teams from across the U.S. will face off in the Australian rules football nationals
item.description: While most fans will be watching college teams hit the gridiron or Major League Baseball playoffs, there's another sporting event happening: the U.S. championship of the Australian Football League.
item.content:encoded: While most fans will be watching college teams hit the gridiron or Major League Baseball playoffs, there's another sporting event happening: the U.S. championship of the Australian Football League.
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla

item.title: Shooter at ICE facility in Dallas was a 'loner' who didn't talk much, his family said
item.description: What motivated the shooter who last month killed two detainees at a Dallas ICE field office? Experts say it's less about politics and more about a desire for notoriety
item.content:encoded: What motivated the shooter who last month killed two detainees at a Dallas ICE field office? Experts say it's less about politics and more about a desire for notoriety
item.dc:creator: Caroline Love
